page.title: 14CLERK TO THE PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: I am clerk to the Parish Council of St. Margarets which meets on the second Monday of every month. There are nine Councillors who are elected by Parishioners over 18 years of age. Each member of the Council serves for four years. I am the only one employed by the Council, and you could best describe my role as that of Secretary I deal with all clerical aspects of the parish: people wanting Planning Permission are always ringing up to enquire constantly. I have to sign cheques,make notes of complaints to be brought up at future committee meetings. I also hold the titles and deeds owned by the council. When we meet in the old school, the public are allowed to attend and they have the freedom to question the council. All in all I find it very interesting being the Parish Clerk.
